intro: Calochortus galei, commonly known as the Sierra death camas, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and meadows. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single, upright stem. Calochortus galei is often found in California and Nevada, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
